item.title: Beocord 9000: Belt Deterioration
item.description:
Replacing rubber belts is a standard restoration procedure for old audio equipment. However, Beocord 8000 and 9000 tape decks often require an extra step: cleaning up the mess left behind by deteriorated belts. Most Beocords I’ve encountered have belts degraded into a sticky, gooey substance, probably due to prolonged storage in warm conditions. Like cars, these devices suffer from lack of regular use. This picture shows the residue found in this Beocord, a common sight...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/beocord-9000-belt-deterioration/
